summary: This document is an email chain from August 2019 between attorneys and a U.S. Attorney's office, coordinating interviews for two clients who allege they were assaulted by Jeffrey Epstein in or around June 2004. The emails discuss scheduling in-person and video conference interviews, travel logistics, and the submission of client photographs from 2004 for identification against photos seized from Epstein's home.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the criminal case (19 Cr. 490 (RMB)) and the individual whom the attorney's clients allege assaulted them in or around June 2004.

events.title: Alleged Assaults by Epstein
events.description: Two clients of a law firm believe they were assaulted by Jeffrey Epstein in or around June 2004.

events.title: Initial Attorney Call with Prosecutors
events.description: Attorneys from a firm spoke with the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding their clients who are alleged victims of Epstein.

events.title: Scheduled In-Person Victim Interview
events.description: A scheduled meeting at the prosecutor's office for an in-person interview with one alleged victim, Ms. [Redacted 1], to be accompanied by her New York attorney.

events.title: Scheduled Video Conference Victim Interview
events.description: A scheduled video conference interview (via Skype) with another alleged victim, Ms. [Redacted 2].

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The email chain coordinates interviews for two new alleged victims in the Epstein case (SDNY case 19 Cr. 490).
The alleged assaults are said to have occurred in or around June 2004.
Attorneys submitted photographs of their clients from 2004 and asked prosecutors to check if they appear in photos seized from Epstein's home.
The communications are explicitly marked 'CONFIDENTIAL' and relate to 'Victim Reports Against Jeffrey Epstein'.
The document reveals ongoing investigative activity by the SDNY in August 2019, shortly before Epstein's death.
